result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Armand Louis Beauchamp

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Armand Louis Beauchamp not in court.  Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson in court for Armand Louis Beauchamp.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Statements by defense that defendant's pending case in Branch 16 is scheduled for resolution in February 2023 and requests a status date at that time. Court orders case adjourned for status conference by Zoom, Branch 30
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson in court, defendant Armand Louis Beauchamp not in court, in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense informs the court the case will be resolved in branch 40. Court authorizes transfer to Branch 40 for purposes of a global resolution, if accepted. Court had already authorized transfer to Branch 16.
Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea
Case rescheduled off the record due to judge unavailability.  Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson in court, defendant Armand Louis Beauchamp not in court, in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel advises Court of felony pending cases.  Court will authorize transfer of this case for global resolution.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No contact order signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $1,500.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Pretrial Order, signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with GMG and Speed Queen located at 1130 West Walnut Street

DAR UNAVAILABLE DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES.  CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD.
 Defendant Armand Louis Beauchamp in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Armand Louis Beauchamp in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Armand Louis Beauchamp appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
